description:
'''Nickelback'''  is a Canadian [[Rock music|rock]] band formed in 1995 in [[Hanna, Alberta|Hanna]], [[Alberta]]. Throughout its history, it has consisted of lead guitarist and lead vocalist [[Chad Kroeger]], rhythm guitarist, keyboardist and backing vocalist [[Ryan Peake]], and bassist [[Mike Kroeger]]. It went through several drummer changes between 1995 and 2005 before [[Daniel Adair]] joined.

The band signed with [[Roadrunner Records]] in 1999 and reached a mainstream breakthrough in 2002 with the single "[[How You Remind Me]]", which reached number one in the United States and Canada. Its parent album, ''[[Silver Side Up]]'', would go on to be certified 8Ã— Platinum in Canada. Nickelback's fourth album, ''[[The Long Road]]'', was released in 2003 and spawned five singles, including Canadian number one "[[Someday (Nickelback song)|Someday]]", which also reached No. 7 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].

In 2005, the band's best-selling album to date, ''[[All the Right Reasons]]'', produced three top-10 and five top-20 singles on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100, including "[[Photograph (Nickelback song)|Photograph]]", "[[Far Away (Nickelback song)|Far Away]]", and "[[Rockstar (Nickelback song)|Rockstar]]", the latter of which was their biggest success in the United Kingdom. Nickelback released eight singles from their sixth album ''[[Dark Horse (Nickelback album)|Dark Horse]]'' (2008), including the United States top-10 track "[[Gotta Be Somebody]]". In 2011, the seventh album ''[[Here and Now (Nickelback album)|Here and Now]]'' topped the charts in Canada. The band has since released ''[[No Fixed Address (album)|No Fixed Address]]'' (2014), ''[[Feed the Machine]]'' (2017), and most recently its 10th album ''[[Get Rollin' (album)|Get Rollin'<nowiki/>]]'' (2022).

Nickelback is one of the most commercially successful Canadian rock bands, having sold more than 50 million albums worldwide. In 2009, ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' ranked it the most successful rock group and the seventh-most successful artist of that decade; "How You Remind Me" was the best-selling rock song and the fourth-best overall. In 2023, Nickelback were inducted into the [[Canadian Music Hall of Fame]].
